content.raw:
My 0.02€:

If the nan comes from the user, we should raise a warning, agree, even an error, but the message should be clear enough to inform the user about it (and ask him/her to fix it), specially if changing nan by a default value will affect the expected behavior. Not sure if this can be done in this case.

If the nan comes from internal component of gazebo, I would say that we should make it to crash while being in development phase (fail fast) and if fixing it generates a heavy unexpected behavior to the user, make it to exit with a clear message about submitting a bug, fix it as soon as possible and make a patch release. I like the idea of the ASSERTS in the case that we want to keep it running for debian package users.
